findings.title: Re-entrancy may lead to stolen ethers
findings.description: A re-entrancy vulnerability may allow a malicious user to send more ethers than expected due to the transaction being executed before it is deleted from the proxy list.

findings.title: Missing loop iteration leads to non-removable validator
findings.description: An improper loop iteration in the constructor functions prevents the removal of a consensus validator from the OwnedSet and InnerOwnedSet contracts.

findings.title: Incorrect interface implementation leads to unexpected behavior
findings.description: SimpleCertifier and ProofOfSMS inherit from Certifier but do not implement the getData function, leading to incorrect results.

findings.title: Incorrect conditional prevents fork rejection
findings.description: An incorrect conditional in the only_unratified modifier prevents forks from being rejected.

findings.title: Uninitialized value leads to an unmodifiable owners list
findings.description: An uninitialized OuterSet in InnerSet renders the owners list in InnerOwnedSet immutable.

findings.title: Race condition may preempt an Ethereum address to email association
findings.description: A race condition in ProofOfEmail may allow an attacker to preempt an Ethereum-address-to-email association.

findings.title: Incorrect interfaces may lead to unexpected behavior
findings.description: ProofOfEmail implements the wrong interface, impacting some of its functions.

findings.title: Incorrect authorization prevents the calling of reporting functions
findings.description: An incorrect authorization schema prevents outerSet from calling the reportBenign and reportMalicious functions.

findings.title: “Unrequired” clients can remove a “required” client’s privilege
findings.description: Lack of validation in setClientOwner allows an “unrequired” client to remove the privilege of a “required” client.

findings.title: Missing contract existence check may cause unexpected behavior
findings.description: The lack of a contract existence check allows calls to an invalid address to return successfully instead of throwing an error, causing the getValidators function to erroneously return an empty list of validators.

findings.title: Race condition may lead to content compromise
findings.description: A race condition may allow an attacker to preempt a GithubHint transaction and associate the specified hash to malicious content.

findings.title: Fork re-proposition may prevent owners from accepting or rejecting a fork
findings.description: A re-proposed fork cannot be confirmed or rejected by certain owners due to the reuse of memory from a deleted fork.

findings.title: Owners cannot accept or reject re-proposed transactions
findings.description: A reproposed transaction cannot be confirmed or rejected by certain owners due to the way the transaction structure is implemented.

findings.title: Lack of argument validation may lead to incorrect deletion of badge information
findings.description: A lack of validation in unregister may lead to the incorrect deletion of information.

findings.title: Deleting clients may lead to incorrect getter values
findings.description: Getter functions return information on clients even after clients are deleted, leading to unexpected behavior in third-party applications or contracts.

findings.title: Deleting entries may lead to incorrect getter value (SimpleRegistry)
findings.description: Getter functions return information on entries even after entries are deleted, which may lead to unexpected behavior in third-party applications or contracts.

findings.title: Deleting dapps may lead to incorrect getter value (DappReg)
findings.description: Getter functions return information on dapps even after dapps are deleted, which may lead to unexpected behavior in third-party applications or contracts.

findings.title: Deleting badges may lead to incorrect getter value (BadgeReg)
findings.description: Getter functions return information on badges even after badges are deleted, which may lead to unexpected behavior in third-party applications or contracts.

findings.title: Empty keyServerIp may lead to incorrect keyServersList
findings.description: KeyServerSet keeps a list of server names associated with IP addresses. A server name can be associated only once. This assumption can be broken by associating a server name with an empty IP address.

findings.title: Contracts specify outdated compiler version
findings.description: Some Parity contracts specify an outdated version of the Solidity compiler, which may lead to bugs and warnings.
